events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of May 1st involving their sedan and another vehicle. They wish to file a claim for damages.
The claim was reviewed and categorised as an auto accident claim due to the reported vehicle collision and damage details.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the case and contact the customer promptly to begin processing the vehicle accident claim.
Customer received official acknowledgment of the filed claim, including instructions on the next steps and documentation required.
The claims department requested photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates to support the investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed pictures of the accident damage and a copy of the police collision report.
The investigation into the claim began, verifying details of the car accident and assessing the liability and extent of damages.
Investigative team concluded their review and confirmed the validity of the claim with no discrepancies found regarding the accident details.
An initial settlement offer was proposed to the customer based on damage assessment and repair cost estimates.
Customer responded with concerns about the settlement amount, believing it does not fully cover the repair expenses.
Due to customer dissatisfaction with the settlement, the claim was escalated to senior management for further review.
After escalation review, the claim was approved for the full requested amount to cover all identified damages from the accident.
The insurance payment covering the car repair costs was issued and transferred to the customerâ€™s account.
The auto accident claim was closed following successful payment and confirmation from the customer that repairs were initiated.
